summary: Comprehensive testing of Coffee Shop Management System with 5 user roles completed. Backend APIs 100% functional (33/33 tests passed), Frontend 100% functional with all role-based dashboards working correctly.

minor.issue: Provided test credentials (test123 password) don't match actual passwords (TestPass123!) in database

issues: Multiple tables with same number (#1) exist - may confuse users

passed_tests: User registration for all 5 roles (customer, cashier, waiter, kitchen, storage)
Customer App at / - public access for ordering
Cashier/POS Dashboard at /pos - cashier role only
Waiter Dashboard at /waiter - waiter role only with Orders and Tables tabs
Kitchen Dashboard at /kitchen - kitchen role only
Storage Dashboard at /storage - storage role only with Ingredients, Products, COGS, Tables tabs
Role-based access control - users cannot access other role's dashboards
Storage can add ingredients, products, COGS entries, and tables
Waiter can view orders, view tables, update table status, create tables
Kitchen can view orders and update order status
Cashier can view orders, view transactions, process payments
Customer can browse products and create orders without authentication
Table QR code generation and verification
critical_code_review_comments: Test credentials in review request (test123) don't match actual database passwords (TestPass123!) - update documentation
seed_data_creation: Created test users for each role during testing with unique timestamps
context_for_next_testing_agent: All 5 user roles (customer, cashier, waiter, kitchen, storage) are fully implemented and tested. Backend uses 'storage' role (not 'inventory_manager'). Test password is 'TestPass123!' not 'test123'. All role-based dashboards redirect correctly. RBAC prevents unauthorized access to protected routes.

test_credentials.note: Use TestPass123! as password, not test123
test_credentials.waiter: Create new user with waiter role
test_credentials.storage: Create new user with storage role
